CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 1, 1952, pg. 2, reads: "Some Negroes Are Proud of Famous Cook Being Impersonated Downtown, Some Aren't - "Aunt Jemima" Comes to Life - Mrs. Iola Green, who has worker for the Quaker Oats Company for four years as a demonstrator for the Aunt Jemima products, this week was dishing out her pancakes in Donahoe's food store downtown. The demonstration attracted considerable attention and comment. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Iola Green dressed as "Aunt Jemima" making pancakes, and waitress in uniform, in Donahoe's food store, Downtown
